text-align: right;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11pt;">. . .For the Respondent No.2 </span></em></strong></span></p><p align="right" class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: right; text-indent: 5.75pt; line-height: 110%; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; line-height: 110%;">[Anti-Corruption Commission]</span><strong><em><span style="font-size: 10pt; line-height: 110%;"> <span style="color: black;"> </span></span></em></strong></span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">JUDGMENT</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 27.35pt; line-height: 110%;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><u><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">M. Enayetur Rahim, J</span></u></strong><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">: </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">On an application</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> under Article 102(1) and (2) of the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh the Rule Nisi was issued  calling upon the respondents to show cause as to why the impugned order dated 09.02.2015 passed by the learned Divisional Special Judge, Dhaka in Special Case No.138 of 2011 arising out of Dhanmondi Model Police Station Case No.10 dated 19.04.2011 rejecting an application filed under section 15 of the Money Laundering Act, 2009 for releasing the petitioner’s property being Flat No.B-2 measuring an area of 2280 Sft along with a car parking space situated at Baig Regency, Plot No.10, Block-CWN(C), Road No.39, Gulshan, Dhaka from attachment should not be declared to have been passed without lawful authority and is of no legal effect and as to why the respondents should not be directed to release the petitioner’s property being Flat No.B-2 measuring of an area of 2280 Sft along with a car parking space situated at Baig Regency, Plot No.10, Block-CWN(C), Road No.39, Gulshan, Dhaka from attachment in favour of the petitioner and/or pass such other or further order or orders as to this Court may seem fit and proper. (As written in the Rule issuing order)</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Short facts for disposal of the Rule are as follows; </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(a).</span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> The petitioner on 13.12.2010 had entered into an agreement with one Md. Arshad Hossain, son of Late Anowar Hossain of village-Sultangonj Para, (Eidgah Lane), Bogra for purchasing the Flat No.B-2 measuring an area of 2280 Sft along with a car parking space situated at Baig Regency, Plot No.10 Block-CWN(c), Road No.39, Gulshan, Dhaka. [here in after referred as property in question] with an amount of Tk. 3,30,00,000/- (Taka three crores and thirty lacs), annexure-B. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(b).</span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">  As per the said agreement for sale the Petitioner had paid an amount of Tk. 30,00,000/- (Taka thirty lacs) to Mr. Arshad Hossain on the date of signing of the said agreement. Thereafter, the petitioner through several cheques on different occasions had paid <span style="letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">entire consideration money, annexures-C-1 to C-3.</span> Md. Arshad Hossain, the vendor after receiving entire amount had handed over the possession of the property in question to the petitioner and informed the same to the Managing Director of Asset Development &amp; Holdings Limited vide a letter dated 26.12.2010, annexure-C.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(c).  </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Subsequently, on 26.12.2010 as per the Rules of the Asset Developments &amp; Holding Limited, the petitioner and the said Md. Arshad Hossain jointly submitted the form for reconfirmation of name of the Petitioner as allottee before registration and for obtaining utilities connections and accordingly the said application was accepted by the Asset Developments &amp; Holding Limited, annexure-D.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(d).  </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Thereafter, vide registered mail dated 01.01.2011 the Asset Developments &amp; Holding Limited had informed the President and General Secretary of Baig Regency Complex Common Management Association regarding the transfer of ownership of flat in question in the name of the petitioner, annexure-E. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(e).  </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Subsequently, through registered mail dated 02.01.2011 the Asset Developments &amp; Holdings Limited had informed the petitioner to pay registration cost of an amount of Tk.9,98,605/- within 31.01.2011 for taking registration of the said flat in her name. The Asset Developments &amp; Holdings Limited through registered mail dated 21.03.2011 also informed the petitioner to pay balance registration cost of an amount of Tk.4,58,170/-. The Asset Developments &amp; Holdings Limited through registered mail dated 05.04.2011 further informed the petitioner to pay balance registration cost of an amount of Tk.7,32,850/- since RAJUK increased land value, annexure-F, F-1 and F-2.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(f).  </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">While the petitioner was waiting for getting registration of the said flat in her name, a case being Dhanmondi Police Station Case No.10 dated 19.04.2011 was filed by the respondent No.2 Anti Corruption Commissioner (here in after referred as Commission) under Section 2(Ka), 4(2) of the Money Laundering Act, 2009 and read with Section 2(tha) (oa) (AA) of the Money Laundering Act, 2009 against the said Md. Arshad Hossain and his wife Mrs. Lubna Islam Loni. Eventually a charge sheet was submitted on 30.06.2011 against them under the above provisions of law.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(g).  </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">However, on behalf of the respondent No. 2, one Md. Ebrahim, Assistant Director of if on 18.05.2011 filed an application under section 10(1) and 14 of the Money Laundering Act, 2009 before the Metropolitan Senior Special Judge, Dhaka (wrongly written in the writ petition as Divisional Special Judge) for attachment of the Petitioner’s aforesaid property along with other properties of the said Md. Arshad Hossain.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(h).  </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">The learned Metropolitan Senior Special Judge, vide Memo No.DMSJ/60(3)/C dated 22.05.2011 allowed the said application for attachment of the petitioner’s aforesaid property along with other properties of the said Md. Arshad Hossain.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(i).   </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">On coming to know about the said fact, the petitioner filed an application to the respondent no.2 stating the facts with a prayer for releasing the property in question from attachment which was received on 25.06.2012 by the respondent no.2 but of no result.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(j).  </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Thereafter, the petitioner challenged the impugned Memo No.DMSJ/60(3)/C dated 22.05.2011 issued by the learned Metropolitan <span style="letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">Senior Special Judge, Dhaka allowing attachment</span> of the petitioner’s property filed a writ petition being writ petition No.3168 of 2013 before this Court. After hearing the respective parties, a Division Bench of this Court by the judgment and order on 24.04.2014 was pleased to discharge the Rule observing that-</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">“However, the legal position is that the petitioner had alternative forum under section 15 of Act to make a prayer for release of the said property and that the provision being part of special law has mandatory effect. As such, without <span style="letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">invoking the said forum filing application</span> under Article 102 of the Constitution challenging the impugned order dated 22.05.2011 passed by the Respondent No.3 about 2(two) years after cannot go to sustain the contention of the petitioner in the eye of law. Moreover, no explanation whatever has been given in the writ petition as to delay in filing the present writ petition.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">At this juncture, Mr. Chowdhury, the learned Advocate for the petitioner submits that since he has no forum to agitate his grievance under section 15 of the Act, 2009 as such, for the cause of justice and equity may be allowed to make a prayer invoking the said provision of law.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">However, considering the context of the case the petitioner is at liberty to make her prayer before the Adalat concern under section 15 of the Act, 2009.”; annexure-J.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(k). </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.1pt;">Accordingly, on 01.11.2014 the petitioner</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> <span style="letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">filed an application under section 15 of the Money</span> Laundering Act, 2009 before the respondent no.3 for releasing the property in question.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(l).   </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">The learned Divisional Special Judge, Dhaka</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> after hearing the said application by its order dated 09.02.2015 rejected the said application. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">2(m).   </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Thus, this application. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">3.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Respondent no.2, the Commission contested the Rule by filing affidavit-in-opposition contending, inter-alia, that the subject matter regarding the writ petition is very much criminal offence arising out a criminal case under the Money Laundering Protirodh Ain, 2009 filed by the concerned authority. The petitioner purchased the property in question from Md. Arshad Hossain who was a Deputy General Manager of Power Grid Company Bangladesh Ltd. (now suspended) against whom a criminal case under the Money Laundering Protirodh Ain, 2009 has been proceeded. The said Company filed a Criminal Case before the Gulshan Police Station against the writ petitioner being Gulshan Police Station Case No.29 dated 08.09.2010 for misappropriation of about Tk.30 (Thirty) crores of the Company.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">4.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">Eventually, Mohammad Ibrahim, Assistant</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> Director (</span><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">¢h: Ae¤: J ac¿¹-1</span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">), Anti Corruption Commission also lodged an F.I.R. under section 2(ta) and 4(2) of the Money Laundering Protirodh Ain, 2009 and section 2(ta)(a)(aa) and section 13 of the Money Laundering Protirodh Ain, 2002 against said Md. Arshed Hossain and another (his wife). The said case was registered as Dhanmondi Police Station Case No.10 dated 19.04.2011.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">5.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong></span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">During the investigation, the respondent <span style="letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">Commission filed 2(two) separated applications</span> vide memo. 6855 dated 18.05.2011 praying for attachment of flats of the writ Petition before the Metropolitan Senior Special Judge, Dhaka. Having got such applications (Annexure-C and C-1), the learned Special Judge allowed the prayer of the Commissioner</span> vide the order No. </span><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';">¢XHjHp­S/48(4)/¢p</span></strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';"> dated 11.04.2011 and the order No. </span><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';">¢XHjHp­S/60(1)/¢p</span></strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';"> dated <span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">22.05.2011 respectively under section 14 of the Money Laundering Protirodh Ain, 2009. Thus, those flats of the writ petitioners were attached by the competent court by exercising the power under the Money Laundering Protirodh Ain, 2009.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">6.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">In the mean time, a charge sheet was submitted under the said Ain, thus the case was numbered as Special Case No.138 of 2011, now pending before Divisional Special Judge Court, Dhaka.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">7.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Previously, the petitioner challenged the impugned Memo No.DMSJ/60(3)/C dated 22.05.2011 issued by the learned Divisional Special Judge, Dhaka allowing attachment of the property in question had filed a writ petition being writ petition No.3168 of 2013 before this Court. After hearing the parties, a Division Bench of this Court on 24.04.2014 was pleased to discharge the Rule with observation that the petitioner had alternative forum under section 15 of the Act to make a prayer for release of the said property. Thereafter, the petitioner moved before the Divisional Special Judge and the learned Special Judge refused his prayer for releasing the property in question. The learned Divisional Special Judge rightly and lawfully passed the impugned order within its jurisdiction. The writ petitioner without availing the forum of appeal has filed this writ petition and as such same is not maintainable. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">8.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Mr. Fazle Noor Taposh appearing with Mr. Mohammad Mehedi Hasan, the learned Advocates having placed the application and the annexures thereto submitted that the present petitioner has become the lawful owner of the property in question on 26.12.2010 i.e. before four months, twenty one days of making of the said application for attachment [ 18.05.2011] and Md. Arshad Hossain had informed the Asset Developments &amp; Holdings Limited regarding entering into the agreement with the petitioner and subsequently, the Asset Development &amp; Holdings Limited has accepted his request and has taken all steps for registration of the property in question in the name of the petitioner. At the time of making application for attachment of the property in question by the Respondent No.2 Md. Arshad Hossain did not have any right, title or interest in the said property and the learned Special Judge failed to consider and appreciate this aspect with reference to the documents submitted by the petitioner.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">9.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Mr. Fazle Noor Taposh lastly submitted that the learned Special Judge failed to understand the purport and scope of section 15(3) of the Money Laundering Protirodh Ain, 2009 and on erroneous view rejected the application of the petitioner who is a bona-fide purchaser of the property in question with value and thus, the impugned order is liable to be declare to have been passed without lawful authority and the property in question may be released from attachment in favour of the petitioner.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">10.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Mr. Syed Mamun Mahbub, the learned Advocate appearing for the respondent no.2, submitted that the instant Writ Petition is not maintainable as specific remedy for filing appeal is available in the Ain, 2009 against an order passed under section 14 of the Ain. The petitioner without availing the statutory right as provided in section 22 of the said Ain has filed the instant writ petition. In this connection Mr. Mahbub referred to the cases of Shafiqur Rahman Vs. Certificate Officer, Dacca and another reported in 29 DLR (SC), page-332, Chairman, Anti Corruption Commission and another Vs. Enayetur Rahman and others, 64 DLR (Ad), Page-14.    </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">11.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Mr. Mahbub further submitted that the fate of the property in question will be decided at the trial on evidence and before conclusion of the trial there is no scope to decide the issue in question.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">12.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">In reply to the submission of the learned Advocate for the respondent no.2 regarding maintainability of the writ petition Mr. Fazle Noor Tapos referring to the cases of Muhammad Amin Khan Vs. Controller of Estate Duty, reported in 13 DLR (SC), page-105, Bangladesh Bank and others Vs. Zafar Ahmed Chowdhury and another, reported in 56 DLR (AD), page-174, Government of the Peoples Republic of Bangladesh and others Vs. Iqbal Hasan Mahmood Tuku, reported in 60 DLR (AD), page-147, Tafizal Huq Sarker Vs. Bangladesh and others, reported in 1981 BLD (AD) page-269 submits that the petitioner has rightly filed the Writ Petition where the question of petitioner’s right to property is involved and filing of appeal was not the equally efficacious remedy.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">13.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Heard the learned Advocate for the respective parties, perused the application, the affidavit in opposition filed by respondent no.2 and the annexures thereto. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">14.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">On perusal of the impugned order dated 09.02.2014 it appears that the learned Special Judge in a mechanical way without assigning any reason whatsoever rejected the application filed by the petition for releasing the property in question from attachment. The learned Special Judge simply held that the said application was not maintainable. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">15.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong></span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Section 15 of the Money Laundering Protirodh Ain, 2009 runs as follows;</span> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';">“</span><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';">[15z Ahl¦ÜL«a h¡ ­œ²¡LL«a pÇf¢š ®gla fÐc¡ez-(1) d¡l¡ 14 Hl Ad£­e Bc¡ma ®L¡e pÇf¢š Ahl¦ÜLlZ h¡ ®œ²¡L B­cn fÐc¡e L¢l­m, A¢ik¤š² hÉ¢š² h¡ pš¡ hÉa£a AeÉ ®L¡e hÉ¢š² h¡ pš¡l Eš² pÇf¢š­a ®L¡e ü¡bÑ b¡¢L­m ¢a¢e h¡ Eš² pš¡ Eq¡ ®gla f¡Ch¡l SeÉ Ahl¦ÜLlZ h¡ ®œ²¡L B­cn fÐQ¡­ll a¡¢lM qC­a 30(¢œn) ¢c­el j­dÉ Bc¡m­a B­hce L¢l­a f¡¢l­hez </span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';">15(2)z Ef-d¡l¡ (1) Hl Ad£e ®L¡e hÉ¢š² h¡ pš¡ Bc¡m­a B­hce L¢l­m B­hcef­œ ¢ejÀh¢ZÑa abÉ¡¢c E­õM L¢l­a qC­h, kb¡x-</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.25in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level2 lfo1; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .75in;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-fareast-font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: MoinaNormal;"><span style="mso-list: Ignore;">(L) </span></span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';">j¡¢emä¡¢lw h¡ ®L¡e pÇfªš² Afl¡­dl p¢qa Eš² pÇf¢šl fÐaÉr h¡ f­l¡ri¡­h ®L¡e pw¢nÔøa¡ e¡C;</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.25in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level2 lfo1; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .75in;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-fareast-font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: MoinaNormal;"><span style="mso-list: Ignore;">(M) </span></span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';">B­hceL¡l£ fÐaÉr h¡ f­l¡ri¡­h A¢ik¤š² j¡¢emä¡¢lw h¡ AeÉ ®L¡e pÇfªš² Afl¡­dl p¡­b pÇfªš² ee;</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.25in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level2 lfo1; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .75in;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-fareast-font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: MoinaNormal;"><span style="mso-list: Ignore;">(N) </span></span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';">B­hceL¡l£ A¢ik¤­š²l e¢je£ ee h¡ A¢ik¤­š²l f­r ®L¡e c¡¢uaÅ f¡me L¢l­a­Re e¡;</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.25in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level2 lfo1; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .75in;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-fareast-font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: MoinaNormal;"><span style="mso-list: Ignore;">(O) </span></span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';">Ahl¦ÜLlZ h¡ ®œ²¡LL«a pÇf¢š­a A¢ik¤š² hÉ¢š² h¡ pš¡l ®L¡e üaÅ, ü¡bÑ h¡ j¡¢mL¡e¡ e¡C; Hhw </span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.25in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level2 lfo1; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .75in;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-fareast-font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: MoinaNormal;"><span style="mso-list: Ignore;">(P) </span></span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';">Ahl¦ÜLlZ h¡ ®œ²¡LL«a pÇf¢š­a B­hceL¡l£l üaÅ, ü¡bÑ J j¡¢mL¡e¡ l¢qu¡­Rz </span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.5in; line-height: 110%; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 1.0in;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaNormal; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';">15(3)z d¡l¡ 14 Hl Ef-d¡l¡ (5) H k¡q¡ ¢LR¤C b¡L¥L e¡ ®Le, HC d¡l¡l Ad£e pÇf¢š ®gla f¡Ch¡l SeÉ Bc¡ma ®L¡e B­hcefÐ¡ç qC­m B­hceL¡l£, ac¿¹L¡l£ pwÙÛ¡ J A¢ik¤š² hÉ¢š² h¡ pš¡­L öe¡e£l p¤­k¡N fÐc¡e L¢l­he Hhw öe¡e£ A­¿¹, fÐ­u¡Se£u L¡NS¡¢c fkÑ¡­m¡Qe¡œ²­j J l¡øÌ La«ÑL h¢ZÑa pÇf¢š­a fÐaÉr h¡ f­l¡ri¡­h j¡¢emä¡¢lw h¡ pÇfªš² Afl¡­dl p¡­b pÇfªš²a¡l NËqZ­k¡NÉ p­¾c­ql ®L¡e L¡lZ EfÙÛ¡fe e¡ L¢l­m, Ef-d¡l¡ (1) Hl Ad£e c¡¢MmL«a B­hceL¡l£l B­hce pÇf­LÑ Bc¡ma p¿ºø qC­m <span style="letter-spacing: -.2pt;">Ahl¦ÜLlZ h¡ ®œ²¡L B­cn h¡¢amœ²­j</span> pÇf¢š¢V, B­c­n E¢õ¢Ma ¢edÑ¡¢la pj­ul j­dÉ, B­hceL¡l£l Ae¤L¥­m qÙ¹¡¿¹­ll B­cn fÐc¡e L¢l­hez]</span></strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Courier New';">” </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman';"><span style="mso-list: Ignore;">16.<span style="font: 7.0pt 'Times New Roman';">        </span></span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Similar provision has been made in section 15 of the Money Laundering Ain, 2012.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">17.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">If we consider the above provision of law coupled with the impugned order we have no hesitation to hold that the learned Special Judge has failed to exercise its statutory obligation as provided in law and thus, came to an erroneous decision in passing the impugned order. He ought to have held an inquiry upon the application for releasing the property in question from attachment filed by the petitioner in the manner as prescribed in section 15(3) of the Ain, 2009 or Ain, 2012, which is applicable in the instant case, and as such the impugned order was passed without complying the relevant provision of law. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">18.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">In the case of Lt. Col. Nawabzada Muhammad Amin Khan Vs The Controller of Estate Duty and others, reported in 13 DLR (SC), page-105 it has been held that:</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">“The rule that the Court will not entertain a writ petition when other appropriate remedy is yet available is not a rule of law barring the jurisdiction of the Court. It is a rule by which the Court regulates the exercise of its own discretion.”</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">19.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Above view has been reiterated in the case of Bangladesh Bank and others Vs Zafar Ahmed Chowdhury and another, reported in 56 DLR (AD), page-175. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">20.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">In the said case it has been held that:</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">“On an examination of the requisition orders, we have already held that they are unauthorized, illegal and void. It has been recently held by their Lordships of the Supreme Court in Muhammad Amir Khan Vs Controller of Estate Duty (PLD 1961 SC 119), that if an order affecting one’s legal right is challenged as wholly without authority, an alternative in the way of the exercise of writ jurisdiction rather a petition for a writ, in the opinion of their Lordships, is a more appropriate remedy in such a case. Therefore, the writ petition is maintainable on the authority of the decision in the case cited above, <u>although the remedies, by way of appeal and revision provided in section 4A of the Act were not availed of.”</u></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 27.0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">The principle of law laid down in the above referred decision is the principle in which the aggrieved party instead of availing the appellate forum could avail the writ jurisdiction in spite of alternative remedy by way of appeal <u>which is not likely to be equally efficacious and effective in facts and circumstances of the case basing on the established principle that</u>:</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 27.0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">“the rule that the Court will not entertain, a writ petition when the appropriate remedy is yet available is not a rule of law barring the jurisdictions of the Court. It is a rule by which the Court regulates the exercise of its own discretion.” [Under lines supplied]</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">21.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">In the case of Chairman, Anti Corruption commissioner and another Vs. Enayetur Rahman, The Appellate Division held that:</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">“The High Court Division will not allow a litigant to invoke the extra ordinary jurisdcition to be converted into courts of appeal or revision. It is only where statutory remedies are entirely ill suited to meet the demands of extra ordinary situations that is to say where vires of a statute is in question or <u>where the determination is malafide or where any action is taken by the executives in contravention of the principles of natural justice or where the fundamental right of a citizen has been affected by an act or</u> where the statute is <em>intra vires</em> but the action taken is without jurisdiction and the vindication of public justice require that recourse may be had to Article 102(2) of the Constitution.” [Under lines supplied].</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">22.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">Having considered the above propositions</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> of law and the facts and circumstances of the present case particularly the claim of the petitioner that her right of property has been affected and the nature of the impugned order, we are unable to accept the submission of Mr. Mamun Mahbub, the learned Advocate appearing for the Commission, that the writ petition is not maintainable. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">23.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Moreover, the writ petitioner is not an accused in the case in connection of which the properties in question have been attached. If, <span style="letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">we discharge the Rule on mere technical ground</span> of maintanibility after a long period of issuance <span style="letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">of the Rule the petitioner may not have any remedy</span> in future. Because, the period of limitation has already been expired after the issuence of the Rule Nisi to file an appeal under the Ain, 2009 or 2012 and under the special law there is no scope to get condonation of delay.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">24.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">Having discussed and considered as above,</span><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> <span style="letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">we are inclined to make the Rule absolute in part.</span> </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">25.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Accordingly, the Rule is made absolute in part without any order as to cost.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">26.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">The order dated 09.02.2015 passed by the learned Divisional Special Judge, Dhaka in Special Case No.138 of 2011 arising out of Dhanmondi Model Police Station Case No.10 dated 19.04.2011 rejecting the application filed under section 15 of the Money Laundering Act, 2009 for releasing the petitioner’s property being Flat No.B-2 measuring an area of 2280 Sft along with a car parking space situated at Baig Regency, plot No.10, Block-CWN(c), Road No.39, Gulshan, Dhaka from attachment is declared to have been passed without lawful authority and is of no legal effect. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">27.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">The Special Judge is directed to dispose of the application filed by the petitioner under section 15 of the Money Laundering Protirodh Ain, 2009 on merit in the light of the procedure as directed in the law within 3(three) months from the date of receipt of this order. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">28.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">It is pertinent to mention that making an inquiry under section 15(3) of the Money Laundering Protirodh Ain, 2009 or Ain, 2012 is an independent procedure and it has no connection with the proceeding of the trial. As such the trial court is directed to proceed with the trial in accordance with law.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 27.0pt; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Ed. </span></strong></span></p><div style="mso-element: footnote-list;"><br clear="all"/><hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"/><div id="ftn1" style="mso-element: footnote;"><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><a href="#_ftnref1" name="_ftn1" title=""><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 10pt; line-height: 110%;">Writ Petition No. 3998 of 2015</span></strong></a></span></p></div></div></div></div>

text-align: center;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">-Versus-</span></strong></span></p><p class="Default"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; letter-spacing: -0.1pt;">Md. Mofizul Islam</span></strong></span></p><p align="right" class="Default" style="text-align: right;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">. . . <u>Respondent</u></span></strong></span></p></td></tr></tbody></table></div><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 12.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Police Officers (Special Provisions) Ordinance (LXXXIV of 1976)</span></strong></span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Section 6</span></strong></span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">There is no requirement of allowing the delinquent police officer to cross examine the witnesses in an inquiry. Only if he desires then he should get a chance of hearing in person and in this case admittedly he was present before the inquiry authority and chance of hearing was given. We have no hesitation to find that the enquiry proceeding was a legal one and as such, the punishment imposed upon the respondent was also legal one and there was nothing to interfere with the order of punishment. So the decisions made by the Tribunals below are not sustainable and are liable to be set aside.                           . . .(9)</span></strong></span></p><p> </p><p class="CM10" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.5in; tab-stops: right 150.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 1.0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">For the Appellants</span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;"> : Mr. Biswajit Deb Nath, D.A.G instructed by Md. Ibrahim Khalil, Advocate-on-Record.</span> </span></p><p> </p><p class="CM10" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.5in; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 1.0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">For the Respondents </span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">: Mr. Abdul <span style="letter-spacing: -0.5pt;">Wadud Bhuiyan, Senior Advocate</span> <span style="letter-spacing: -0.5pt;">instructed by Mr. Syed Mahbubur</span> Rahman, Advocate-on-Record.</span></span></p><p> </p><p align="center" class="CM1" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: center; line-height: 110%;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-variant: small-caps;">JUDGMENT</span></strong></span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 27.0pt; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><u><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-variant: small-caps;">Md. Nizamul huq, j.</span></u></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> This appeal, by leave, is from the decision dated 24.02.2008 passed by the Administrative Appellate Tribunal, Khulna in Administrative Appellate Tribunal Appeal No.6 of 2008 dismissing the appeal and thereby affirming the order dated 23.10.2007 passed by the Administrative Tribunal, Khulna in Administrative Tribunal Case No.23 of 2007 allowing the case of the respondent with all arrear salaries and other allowances with the further direction to reinstate him in his service.</span></span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">2.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The facts, leading to the filing of this appeal, in a nutshell, are:</span></span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">         The respondent, while had been serving as Sub-Inspector of Police at Satkhira District, the Additional Superintendent of Police held a preliminary enquiry against him on the basis of petition filed by one Ashad Ali through the Assistant Superintendent of Police, Satkhira. On the basis of that enquiry the respondent was suspended and the departmental proceeding was started against him and after completion of the departmental proceedings, he was retired from service compulsorily by the order dated 08.04.2007. Against the order the respondent preferred departmental appeal before the appellate authority and it was rejected on 14.05.2007. Then the respondent filed Administrative Tribunal Case No.23 of 2007 before the Administrative Tribunal, Khulna for setting aside the order of his compulsory retirement. </span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">         The appellants contested the case by filing written statement contending, inter-alia, that the departmental enquiry against the respondent was held according to law and since <span style="color: red;">he was proved to be a corrupt officer, he was rightly</span> given compulsory retirement from service according to the Police Officers(special provision) Ordinance-1976, shortly the Ordinance, 1976. </span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">         The Administrative Tribunal, Khulna, upon hearing both the sides by its decision dated 23.10.2008 allowed the case declaring that the order dated 08.04.2007, compulsory retiring the respondent from service was illegal, inoperative and not binding upon the respondent. It was further declared that the respondent was still in service and the appellants were directed to pay him the due salaries and other benefits and also to reinstate him in service.  </span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">         Being aggrieved by and dissatisfied with the decision dated 23.10.2007 passed by the  Administrative Tribunal, Khulna, the appellants herein preferred Administrative Appellate Tribunal Appeal No.06 of 2008 before the Administrative Appellate Tribunal, Khulna. The Administrative Appellate Tribunal, upon hearing the parties, by its decision dated 23.10.2007 dismissed the appeal and affirmed the decision passed by the Administrative Tribunal, Khulna.   </span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">         Feeling aggrieved by and dissatisfied with the decision passed by the Administrative Appellate Tribunal Khulna, the appellants filed civil petition for leave to appeal No.1398 of 2008 before this Division and leave was granted to consider the submission that both the Tribunals failed to consider that there was no legal bar in proceeding against the respondent “on allegation and charges”. </span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoBodyText" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">3.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Mr. Biswajit Debnath, learned Deputy Attorney General for the appellants has submitted that the Administrative Tribunal and the Administrative Appellate Tribunal gave their decision without considering the true perspective of the case and without considering the law points involved in it. He has submitted that the enquiry procedures of police officers are guided by section 6 of the Ordinance-1976 but the Tribunals considered </span></span><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaBold;">plL¡l£ LjÑQ¡l£ nªwMm¡ J Bf£m ¢h¢dj¡m¡-1985</span></strong><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"> and thus went in a wrong way in deciding the matter. Moreover, they considered a case being No.84 of 1998 wherein it was found that</span> </span><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaBold;">HLalg¡i¡­h ac¿¹ Ll¡ qCu¡ b¡¢L­m Hhw B­hceL¡l£ Ae¤f¢ÙÛ¢a­a p¡r£­cl­L ¢S‘¡p¡h¡c Ll¡ qCu¡ b¡¢L­m Eš²l©f ¢l­f¡­VÑl Efl ¢i¢š L¢lu¡ n¡¢Ù¹ ®cJu¡ pÇf§ZÑ ®hBCe£z</span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"> But it was not stated whether the case related to a police officer or not, even it was not stated whether Ordinance No. LXXXIV of 1976 was considered or not. </span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoBodyText" style="margin-left: 0in; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">4.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Sub-section(2) of section 6 of the Ordinance has provided that if the incumbent desires that he should be heard in person then he should be heard, there is nothing regarding cross examination of the witnesses. The learned Deputy Attorney General has further submitted that in the instant case the incumbent officer was present before the enquiry authority and he was heard in person as such, the question of illegality of the enquiry procedure does not stand. He has further submitted that the Tribunals were wrong in holding that the incumbent was not allowed to cross examine the witnesses and for that the enquiry proceeding was illegal. On these submissions he placed before us the petition which the respondent submitted before the Administrative Tribunal and in the petition reasons “</span><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">W</span></strong><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">”</span></strong></span><span style="font-size: 11.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"> reads as follows:</span> </span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoBodyText" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 27.0pt;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: MoinaBold;">""B­hceL¡l£ Na Cw 15/03/2007 a¡¢l­Ml ¢m¢Ma L¡lZ cnÑ¡­e¡l ®e¡¢V­nl Sh¡­h ¢a¢e hÉ¢š²Na öe¡e£l SeÉ ¢e­hce L­le ¢L¿º 4ew fË¢afr B­hceL¡l£­L ®L¡e hÉ¢š²Na öe¡e£l pju A¢i­k¡NL¡l£ pq AeÉ¡eÉ p¡r£Ne­L ®L¡e ®Sl¡ Ll¡l p¤­k¡N fËc¡e e¡ Ll¡u 4ew fË¢afr LaÑªL B­hceL¡l£l ¢hl¦­Ü Be£a k¡ha£u fË¢p¢Xw ­hBCe£, AL¡kÑLl, HL¡­cncn£ qC­a­Rz''<span style="mso-spacerun: yes;">  </span></span></strong></p><p> </p><p class="MsoBodyText" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; tab-stops: 27.0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt;"><span style="mso-tab-count: 1;">         </span><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">that means the respondent was allowed to be present in the inquiry and he was heard but he was not allowed to cross examine the witnesses. Since section 6(2) of the Ordinance has not given any right to the delinquent to cross examine the witnesses the enquiry procedure without giving chance to the respondent to cross examine the witnesses was a legal one and no illegality was committed in not allowing him to cross examine the witnesses and no illegality was committed in doing so. </span></span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoBodyText" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">5.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">On the other hand, Mr. Abdul Wadud Bhuiyan, learned Advocate for the respondent has supported the decision of the Tribunals and has prayed for dismissal of the appeal.  </span></span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoBodyText" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">6.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">We have considered the submissions of the learned Deputy Attorney General and the learned Advocate for the respondent and perused the impugned decision and the other materials on record. </span></span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">7.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">It appears that the Administrative Tribunal declared the order of compulsory retirement of the respondent relying on the decision given in the case of Government of Bangladesh represented by the Secretary, Ministry of Home Affairs and others versus Syed Ali Imam decided by the Administrative Appellate Tribunal in Administrative Appellate Tribunal Appeal No.84 of 1998 wherein it was held as under:</span></span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 27.0pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">   “The proceeding case record shows that the said preliminary enquiry was held by Reserve Inspector Mr. Abdul <span style="letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">Aziz who examined the aforesaid witnesses</span> and submitted report accordingly. Use of such preliminary report and ex-parte statements of witnesses behind the back of the petitioner is against the cardinal principle of natural justice. Holding him guilty of the charge on the basis of such preliminary evidence in an informal inquiry and punishing him accordingly in a formal proceeding has been quite illegal.”</span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">8.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">From the judgment of the Appellate Tribunal it appear that it simply endorsed the view of the Administrative Tribunal without applying its our independent mind and considering the provision of the Ordinance, 1976.</span></span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">9.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Upon consideration of the petition filed before the Administrative Tribunal by the respondent and upon consideration of section-6 of the Ordinance, we are satisfied that the authority followed the inquiry procedure as laid down in the said section. There is no requirement of allowing the delinquent police officer to cross examine the witnesses in an inquiry. Only if he desires then he should get a chance of hearing in person and in this case admittedly he was present before the inquiry authority and chance of hearing was given. We have no hesitation to find that the enquiry proceeding was a legal one and as such, the punishment imposed upon the respondent was also legal one and there was nothing to interfere with the order of punishment. So the decisions made by the Tribunals below are not sustainable and are liable to be set aside. </span></span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">10.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Admittedly the respondent was a Sub-inspector of Police to the Provisions of Ordinance, 1976 were applicable to him. And in section 6 of the Ordinance, it has been laid down as to how a police officer shall be proceeded against for the commission of any of the offices mentioned in section 4 thereof. </span></span></p><p> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">11.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">In the result, the appeal is allowed. The order of compulsory retirement imposed upon the respondent is hereby affirmed. </span></span></p><p> </p><p class="CM17" style="margin-bottom: 9.15pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 24.0pt; line-height: 110%;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">    There will be no order as to cost.</span></p><p> </p><p class="Default" style="text-indent: 24.0pt;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong>Ed. </strong></span></p><p> </p><div style="mso-element: footnote-list;"><br clear="all"/><hr align="left" size="1" width="33%"/><div id="ftn1" style="mso-element: footnote;"><p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: 115%;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><a href="#_ftnref1" name="_ftn1" title=""><strong><u><span style="font-size: 10pt; line-height: 115%;">CIVIL APPEAL NO. 313 of 2009.  </span></u></strong></a><u></u></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: 115%;"><span style="font-size: 9pt; line-height: 115%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">(From the judgment and order dated 24.02.2008 passed by the Administrative Appellate Tribunal, Chittagong in A.T. Appeal No.6 of 2008).</span></p></div></div><p> </p><p> </p></div></div>
