Masud Hossain Dolon and others </span></strong></span></p><p align="right" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: right;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">. . . Petitioners</span></strong></span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">-Versus-</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Governemnt of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh represented by the Secretary, Ministry of Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs, Bangladesh Secretariat, Ramna, Dhaka and others</span></strong></span></p><p align="right" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: -.1in; text-align: right;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">. . . Respondents</span></strong></span></p></td></tr></tbody></table></div><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Constitution of Bangladesh, 1972</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Article 102</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">It is ex-facie clear that the primary school children carrying bags more than 10% of their body weight are exposed to various health hazards and complications</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">. Nobody questions the health problems</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> or hazards arising out of carrying of heavier school bags. But even then, no concrete or tangible steps have been taken by the authorities concerned to reduce the weight </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">of school bags of the primary school children</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> effectively as yet.       . . . (27)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Constitution of Bangladesh, 1972</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Article 35(5)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">What we are driving at boils down to this: burdening the primary school children with school bags weighing more than 10% of their body weight amounts to subjecting them to cruel treatment. This is a manifest violation of Article 35(5) of our Constitution. Needless to say, this is also a violation of human rights. Under the circumstances, we </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">can not remain oblivious and unmindful of the</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> cruelty and violation of human rights that are being perpetrated upon our kids.                                     ...(28)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Constitution of Bangladesh, 1972</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Article 102</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Admittedly there is no specific law regulating prohibition of use of school bags more than 10% of the body weight of the primary school children. We have already observed that in the absence of any such law, our kids are exposed to health hazards and as a matter of fact, they are suffering various health ailments. So the enactment of a specific law to that effect is indispensably necessary.        . . . (32)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Constitution of Bangladesh, 1972</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Article 102</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: right 210.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">The respondents are hereby directed to take immediate necessary steps so that a specific law is enacted prohibiting use of school bags more than 10% of the body weight of the primary school children within a period of 6(six) months from the date of receipt of a </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">copy of this judgment. However, as an interim</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> measure, that is to say, till enactment of a specific legislation in this regard, the respondent no. 3 is directed to issue a new circular in supersession of the earlier one </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">(Annexure-‘1’ to the Affidavit-in-Opposition)</span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> embodying therein the provisions relating to the establishment of a monitoring cell and providing for a punitive mechanism in case of failure to comply with the terms thereof by the primary school authorities within a period of 30(thirty) days from the date of receipt of a copy of this judgment. The respondent no. 5, being the Secretary of the Administrative Ministry of the respondent no. 3, shall bear all the responsibility in this respect.           </span></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">. . .(34)</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Mr. Mohammed Ziaul Hoque, Advocate in person with</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Mr. S. M. Masud Hossain Dolon, Advocate in person,</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Mr. Anwarul Karim, Advocate in person and</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: .5in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Ms. Nusrat Jahan, Advocate</span></p><p align="right" class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: right; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><em><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">. . . For the petitioners.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">Mr.</span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;"> Md.</span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;"> Motaher Hossain (Sazu), DAG with</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Ms. Purabi Rani Sharma, AAG and</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left: .5in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Ms. Purabi Saha, AAG</span></p><p align="right" class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: right; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">. . . For the respondent No. 3.</span></strong><strong><em><span style="font-size: 11pt;">  <span style="color: black;"> </span></span></em></strong></span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: center;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 11pt;">JUDGMENT</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 27.0pt; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><u><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Moyeenul Islam Chowdhury, J</span></u></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">:  </span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">On an application under Article 102 of the Constitution of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh filed by the petitioners, a Rule Nisi was issued calling upon the respondents to show cause as to why a direction should not be given upon them to enact a specific law prohibiting use of school bags more than 10% of the body weight of the primary school children as the carrying of school bags weighing more than 10% of their body weight will have serious short-term and long-term clinical effects on their bodies and/or such other or further order or orders passed as to this Court may seem fit and proper.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; mso-list: l7 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">2.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">The case of the petitioners, as set out in the Writ Petition, in short, is as follows: </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">         The petitioners are regular practitioners as Advocates of the High Court Division of the <span style="letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">Supreme Court of Bangladesh. As representatives</span> of the people of the locality, they have come up with the instant Writ Petition in order to protect child right and child health and to redress a public wrong or public injury. Furthermore, the children of the petitioners are studying in different schools and being conscious fathers, they have invoked the writ jurisdiction of the High Court Division under Article 102 of the Constitution for securing the good health of their children. In Bangladesh, the school pupils are carrying heavy school bags due to which they suffer irreversible back problems and a growing number of children are developing irreversible back deformities because of the weight of the bags they carry to their respective schools. Pupils routinely carry their bags filled with heavy books, sports kit and packed lunchboxes. Medical experts say that almost half of the children suffer back pain by the age of 14. Health experts further say that the school children risk long-term health complications and ultimately permanent damage if they regularly carry more than 15% of their body weight over their shoulders. Many youngsters carry as much as 20% of their body weight to and from school. According to the health experts, the maximum weight a child should carry is one-tenth (10%) of his body weight including all things like his water bottle, lunchbox etc. In case of overweight bag, the immediate ill-effects are back, neck and shoulder pain along with tingling, numbness and weakness in the hands. There may also be fatigue and an early development of poor posture. The long-term ill-effects will be strain on the neck and shoulder leading to headache, damage to the spine giving rise to problems like kyphosis-hunched back or spine bent forward; scoliosis-spine bent sideways; reducing breathing capacity due to pressure on the lungs resulting from a forward or sideways bent posture and so on and so forth. In India, a bill titled “The Children School Bag Bill, 2006” was tabled in the Rajya Sabha providing that kindergarten children should carry no bags and for older children, school bags should not be heavier than 10% of their body weight. The bill also specifies on the part of the school authorities to provide lockers; because children may bring other items, such as sports equipment and other books etc. that need to be stored. The State of Maharashtra of India has already formulated some guidelines and stated that the weight of the school bag will not be more than 10% of the body weight of the children. However, in Bangladesh, there is no specific law in this regard. In the absence of any such law, the school authorities are exercising autocracy in running their schools and the pupils are suffering health problems. The Directorate of Education makes syllabi for the primary classes, but the school authorities unhesitatingly and illegally add two or three subjects to the syllabi made by the Directorate of Education. Anyway, the matter was discussed in our Parliament on 05.07.2015 and the Minister for Education also admitted that there are no guidelines for school bag weight. The overweight of school bag has short-term and long-term clinical effects and if the criteria for school bag weight are not set, the children will face immediate health problems. Eye-catching news-items have been published in various newspapers on this issue. This being the scenario, for securing a unique education system and for protecting child health and child right, a specific law should be framed for determining school bag weight. In the absence of any law in this respect, the school authorities force the children to bring all the books and exercise books (note books) regularly. Since the school authorities add additional subjects to the curriculum prescribed by the Government, the children are bound to carry all the books and other materials every day. The scenario is more painful and vivid in English medium schools. Forcing the children to carry heavy school books is a violation of human rights. So the respondents are duty bound to enact a specific law for school bag weight.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l7 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">3.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">In the Supplementary Affidavit filed on behalf of the petitioners, it has been averred that the Directorate of Education (School), Delhi, India issued a circular on 06.05.2014 making some suggestions for reducing the weight of school bag. Besides, the Education Bureau, Hong Kong made some guidelines considering that overweight school bags would bring additional stress and fatigue to the primary and junior secondary students and as a precautionary measure, students should avoid carrying school bags which exceed 10% of their body weight for a long period of time.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l7 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">4.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">The respondent no. 3 has contested the Rule by filing an Affidavit-in-Opposition. His case, as set out in the Affidavit-in-Opposition, in short, runs as follows:</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 12.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">         The respondents are always engaged in protecting the people’s interest as well as the rights of the children. As such the respondent no. 3 (Director-General, Directorate of Primary Education) issued a circular to all Government and Non-Government Primary Schools of Bangladesh prohibiting use of school bags more than 10% of the body weight of the children on 11.12.2014. However, after disposal of the instant Rule by the High Court Division, the respondent no. 3 will secure a fair and unique education system and protect the health and rights of the children in accordance with its directives. The respondent no. 3 must form a cell with a view to monitoring the compliance of the circular dated 11.12.2014.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l7 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">5.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">At the outset, Mr. Mohammed Ziaul Hoque, learned Advocate appearing in person before this Court, submits that there is no specific law regarding the school bag weight of primary school children in Bangladesh and in the absence of any such law, the school authorities are exercising autocracy in running their respective schools and the children are compelled to carry heavy school bags which are even up to 20% of their body weight for which they are suffering serious health problems.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l7 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">6.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; letter-spacing: -0.3pt;">Mr. Mohammed Ziaul Hoque also submits</span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> that the overweight of the school bags <span style="letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">has both short-term and long-term clinical effects</span> on the children which pose a serious threat to their shoulder, lungs and bones and if the criteria for school bag weight are not set, they will go through immense health complications. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l7 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">7.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Mr. Mohammed Ziaul Hoque also submits that in the absence of any specific law, the children are forced to carry all the books and exercise books (note books) to their respective schools every day and as the school authorities add subjects of their own choice to the curriculum prescribed by the Government, the burden of school bags has become all the more unbearable to them and this act of forcing them to carry heavy school bags is a violation of human rights and that being so, the respondents are duty bound to frame a specific law in this respect.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l7 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">8.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">In support of the above submissions, Mr. Mohammed Ziaul Hoque has drawn our attention to two write-ups, one is titled “<u>Burden of the School Bag: Is Anybody Listening</u>?” written by Seema Shukla Ojha, Assistant Professor, Department of Education in Social Sciences, National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT), New Delhi and the other one is headed “<u>Back Problems Due To Heavy Backpacks in School Children</u>” jointly written by Avantika Rai, a Research Scholar and Shalini Agarawal, an Assistant Professor, Department of Human Development and Family Studies, School for Home Science, Babashaheb Bhim Rao Ambedakar (A Central University) Lucknow, India. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l7 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">9.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">            </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Per contra, Mr. Md. Motaher Hossain (Sazu), learned Deputy Attorney-General appearing on behalf of the respondent no. 3, submits that the respondent no. 3, in consideration of the gravity of the situation arising out of heavy school bags of primary school children, issued a circular bearing Memo No.</span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;"> fË¡¢nA/f¢lQ¡mL/f.J A./2014/56(139) </span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">dated 11.12.2014 (Annexure-‘1’ to the Affidavit-in-Opposition) and by that circular, he instructed all the primary school authorities to see that the primary school children do not carry school bags more than 10% of their body weight and if this Court gives any further directions by disposing of the Rule on merit, in that event, he will implement those directions for the benefit of the primary school children.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l7 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">10.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">We have heard the submissions of the learned Advocate Mr. Mohammed Ziaul Hoque and the counter-submission of the learned Deputy Attorney-General Mr. Md. Motaher Hossain (Sazu) and perused the Writ Petition, Supplementary Affidavit, Affidavit-in-Opposition and relevant Annexures annexed thereto.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l7 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">11.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Annexure-‘A’ dated 21.11.2014 is a paper-clipping of “The Daily Prothom Alo” captioned </span></span><span wkïiv KZ IR‡bi e¨vM eB‡e, †m e¨vcv‡i Zv‡`i †Kv‡bv wb‡`©kbv †bB|</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: .25in; line-height: 112%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 112%; font-family: SutonnyBanglaMJ; mso-bidi-language: cvV¨eB‡qi m¤ú~iK, †bvU I MvBW eB‡K e¨v‡M XzKv‡Z bv †`Iqvi Ici|Ó</span></strong></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 112%; mso-list: l7 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%;">12.<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">        </span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%;">Annexure-‘B’ is a write-up titled “<u>The ill-effects of carrying heavy schoolbags</u>” written by one Kriti Saraswat which was downloaded from the internet. This write-up has extensively dealt with the ill-effects of carrying schoolbags by the school children. For proper and effectual adjudication of the Rule, the material portions of the write-up are quoted below:</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">“The vacations are over and it’s time for children to head back to school. But one of the reasons they may dread going back could be the heavy schoolbags they have to carry on their delicate shoulders. This can not only hamper their studies but also cause back and posture problems. Says Dr. Zinal Unadkat, ‘Children lose interest in coming to school with the stress of carrying heavy bags. Their mind is burdened with the weight of the books and this leads to low attention span.’ </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><u><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">So what should be the ideal weight of schoolbags</span></u></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">?</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">According to Dr. Zubeir Patel, the maximum weight children should carry is one-tenth (10%) of their body weight including all things like their water bottle, lunchbox, etc. But the trend these days seems to be 20%, says Dr. Zinal.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><u><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">What happens when the weight exceeds the said limit</span></u></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt;">?</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">‘Carrying very heavy backpacks can lead to musculoskeletal problems, especially if children carry the bag on one shoulder. It puts extra pressure on one side, tilting the spine,’ she says. Dr. Zinal also points out that keeping the bag down and then carrying it again is more dangerous for a growing spine than continuously walking with static weight.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Dr. Patel explains, ‘To carry a heavy bag, the child has to lean forward. This leads to developing a bad posture. The spine is a stack of bones called the vertebral column with the bones separated by a cartilage called the inter vertebral disk and held upright by the muscles and ligaments around it. The excess weight puts undue stress on the muscles, ligaments and disk thus damaging them. The alignment of the column is also disturbed causing it to bend, mostly forward or sideways.’</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">In other words, a heavy bag puts the <span style="letter-spacing: -0.4pt;">child’s health and physical development</span> at risk which can hamper his/her overall growth.</span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: center; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%;">…</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><u><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%;">What immediate and long-term harms can it cause on the child’s health</span></u></strong><strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%;">?</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><u><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%;">Immediate ill-effects:</span></u></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Back, neck and shoulder pain along with tingling, numbness and weakness in the hands.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Fatigue and an early development of poor posture.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><u><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%;">Long-term ill-effects:</span></u></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Strain on the neck and shoulder leading to headache. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Damage to the spine giving rise to problems like kyphosis-hunched back or spine bent forward.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Scoliosis-spine bent sideways.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Reduced breathing capacity due to pressure on the lungs resulting from a forward or sideways bent posture.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Back pain and muscle spasms as young adults which can be traced back to heavy schoolbags.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 112%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 112%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">Every bone has a growth centre or point from which growth of the bone takes place as per age. Carrying excess weight could damage these growth centres leading to stunted or abnormal growth of the bones of the children.</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%; font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">         <strong><u>Here are some useful suggestions by Dr. Smarajit Chakrabarty</u></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.25in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l8 level1 lfo2; tab-stops: list .75in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .75in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">·<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">         </span></span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">A backpack is usually more comfortable than a bag that puts strain on only one shoulder, but even a backpack shouldn’t be overloaded.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.25in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l8 level1 lfo2; tab-stops: list .75in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .75in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">·<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">         </span></span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">When buying a bag, buy a sturdy, well-designed bag with wide, padded shoulder straps that reduces pressure on the neck and shoulder area. Buy a bag with adjustable straps which can be altered as the child grows.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.25in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l8 level1 lfo2; tab-stops: list .75in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .75in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">·<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">         </span></span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Check your child’s posture after he has put the bag on. If you notice that your child is leaning forward or slouching, check if the bag is too heavy or if it has been packed incorrectly. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.25in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l8 level1 lfo2; tab-stops: list .75in; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .75in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">·<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">         </span></span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Make sure your child is only carrying the items he needs for school that day─ remove any unnecessary books and equipment.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 6.0pt; text-align: justify; text-indent: 27.0pt; line-height: 110%; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><strong><u><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Other tips to reduce weight</span></u></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.25in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l4 level1 lfo3; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .75in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">·<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">         </span></span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">School authorities should make it mandatory for students to carry light bags.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.25in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l4 level1 lfo3; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .75in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">·<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">         </span></span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">There should be lockers where students can keep their books and other things which are only needed in the classroom.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: -.25in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l4 level1 lfo3; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt .75in;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">·<span style="font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-language-override: normal; font-kerning: auto; font-synthesis: weight style; font-variant: normal;">         </span></span><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11pt; line-height: 110%;">Schools can allow students to carry one big notebook with sections for all subjects instead of different ones for various subjects.</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; line-height: 110%; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 12.0pt .5in;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; mso-ansi-language: EN;"><span style="font-family: times new roman,times,serif;">These are a few possible solutions that teachers and parents can implement in order to reduce the weight of their kids’ schoolbags. It is important that they understand the gravity of this situation before it is too late.”</span> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in; line-height: 110%; mso-list: l7 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: 27.0pt; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none; margin: 0in 0in 6.0pt 0in;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; mso-bidi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-ansi-language: EN;"><span style="mso-list: Ignore;">13.<span style="font: 7.0pt 'Times New Roman';">        </span></span></span></strong><span lang="EN" style="font-size: 11.0pt; line-height: 110%; mso-ansi-language: EN;">Annexure-‘C’ is also a paper-cutting of “The Daily Prothom Alo” dated 27.07.2015.
